meanings.definition: To make the sound of a word or letter with one's voice.
meanings.sent1: I can pronounce the word 'cat' very well.
meanings.sent2: She will pronounce the alphabet in class tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Why don't we pronounce the word 'banana' in a funny accent?
meanings.sent4: His voice pronounced the word 'silence' with authority.
meanings.sent5: Listen carefully as I pronounce the word 'elephant' loudly.

meanings.definition: To declare or announce formally or officially.
meanings.sent1: The judge will pronounce the verdict in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: They plan to pronounce their marriage vows next week.
meanings.sent3: Let's pronounce today 'Ice Cream Day' and celebrate!
meanings.sent4: The leader pronounced the new policy with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The town crier will pronounce the royal decree at noon.

meanings.definition: To articulate or enunciate words clearly and correctly.
meanings.sent1: It is important to pronounce each syllable when reading.
meanings.sent2: He can pronounce difficult words without any mistakes.
meanings.sent3: I challenge you to pronounce 'supercalifragilisticexpialidocious' perfectly!
meanings.sent4: Her teacher praised her for how well she pronounced the poem.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice beautifully pronounced every note in the song.
